function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Hypochondriacal fears of Europeans of catching diseases from native bodies such as malaria, cholera, and dysentery.","Impact":"Perpetuation of racialized fears and stigmatization of certain populations.","Mitigation":"Education and awareness about the true causes of diseases, addressing cultural biases.","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Native populations, colonizers, public health officials","Owner":"Public health authorities, educational institutions"},{"Description":"Miasma theories explaining disease as resultant from the bad air 'emanating directly from the earth due to heat and humidity.'","Impact":"Misunderstanding of disease transmission and potential neglect of effective preventive measures.","Mitigation":"Promotion and education about germ theory and evidence-based disease transmission knowledge.","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Public health officials, research institutions","Owner":"Public health authorities, educational institutions"},{"Description":"Legacy of hypochondria in the development of housing for British colonizers in tropical places.","Impact":"Inadequate living conditions and public health infrastructure for native populations.","Mitigation":"Reevaluation of housing design and infrastructure to prioritize public health and well-being for all populations.","Technologies":"Modern architectural and urban planning techniques, public health infrastructure design","People":"Native populations, British colonizers, urban planners, architects","Owner":"Urban planners, public health authorities"}]}
